metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2928 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In ISC DHCP 4.4.0 -> 4.4.3, ISC DHCP 4.1-ESV-R1 -> 4.1-ESV-R16-P1, when the function option_code_hash_lookup() is called from add_option(), it increases the option's refcount field. However, there is not a corresponding call to option_dereference() to decrement the refcount field. The function add_option() is only used in server responses to lease query packets. Each lease query response calls this function for several options, so eventually, the reference counters could overflow and cause the server to abort.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2928` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

isc-dhcp-client - 4.3.5-3ubuntu7.4
isc-dhcp-client-ddns - 4.3.5-3ubuntu7.4
isc-dhcp-common - 4.3.5-3ubuntu7.4
isc-dhcp-relay - 4.3.5-3ubuntu7.4
isc-dhcp-server - 4.3.5-3ubuntu7.4
isc-dhcp-server-ldap - 4.3.5-3ubuntu7.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: isc-dhcp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.3.5-3ubuntu7.4').
